025
026package org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.formats.html;
027
028import com.sun.source.doctree.DeprecatedTree;
029
030import java.util.List;
031
032import javax.lang.model.element.Element;
033
034import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.formats.html.Navigation.PageMode;
035import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.formats.html.markup.HtmlAttr;
036import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.formats.html.markup.HtmlId;
037import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.formats.html.markup.HtmlStyle;
038import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.formats.html.markup.HtmlTree;
039import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.formats.html.markup.Text;
040import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.Content;
041import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.util.DeprecatedAPIListBuilder;
042import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.util.DocFileIOException;
043import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.util.DocPath;
044import org.jdrupes.mdoclet.internal.doclets.toolkit.util.DocPaths;
045
046/**
047 * Generate File to list all the deprecated classes and class members with the
048 * appropriate links.
049 */
050public class DeprecatedListWriter
051        extends SummaryListWriter<DeprecatedAPIListBuilder> {
052
053    private static final String TERMINALLY_DEPRECATED_KEY
054        = "doclet.Terminally_Deprecated_Elements";
055
056    /**
057     * Constructor.
058     *
059     * @param configuration the configuration for this doclet
060     * @param filename the file to be generated
061     */
062    public DeprecatedListWriter(HtmlConfiguration configuration,
063            DocPath filename) {
064        super(configuration, filename, configuration.deprecatedAPIListBuilder);
065    }
066
067    /**
068     * Get list of all the deprecated classes and members in all the Packages
069     * specified on the command line.
070     * Then instantiate DeprecatedListWriter and generate File.
071     *
072     * @param configuration the current configuration of the doclet.
073     * @throws DocFileIOException if there is a problem writing the deprecated list
074     */
075    public static void generate(HtmlConfiguration configuration)
076            throws DocFileIOException {
077        if (configuration.conditionalPages
078            .contains(HtmlConfiguration.ConditionalPage.DEPRECATED)) {
079            DocPath filename = DocPaths.DEPRECATED_LIST;
080            DeprecatedListWriter depr
081                = new DeprecatedListWriter(configuration, filename);
082            depr.generateSummaryListFile(PageMode.DEPRECATED,
083                "deprecated elements",
084                configuration.contents.deprecatedAPI,
085                "doclet.Window_Deprecated_List");
086        }
087    }
088
089    @Override
090    protected void addContentSelectors(Content target) {
091        List<String> releases = builder.releases;
092        if (releases.size() > 1) {
093            Content tabs
094                = HtmlTree.DIV(HtmlStyle.checkboxes, contents.getContent(
095                    "doclet.Deprecated_API_Checkbox_Label"));
096            for (int i = 0; i < releases.size(); i++) {
097                // Table column ids are 1-based
098                tabs.add(Text.of(" "))
099                    .add(getReleaseCheckbox(releases.get(i), i + 1));
100            }
101            target.add(tabs);
102        }
103    }
104
105    @Override
106    protected void addExtraSection(Content content) {
107        addSummaryAPI(builder.getForRemoval(), HtmlIds.FOR_REMOVAL,
108            TERMINALLY_DEPRECATED_KEY, "doclet.Element", content);
109    }
110
111    private Content getReleaseCheckbox(String name, int index) {
112        // Empty string represents other/uncategorized releases. Since we can't
113        // make any assumptions
114        // about release names this is arguably the safest way to avoid naming
115        // collisions.
116        boolean isOtherReleases = name.isEmpty();
117        Content releaseLabel = isOtherReleases
118            ? contents
119                .getContent("doclet.Deprecated_API_Checkbox_Other_Releases")
120            : Text.of(name);
121        HtmlId htmlId = HtmlId.of("release-" + index);
122        String releaseId = isOtherReleases ? "" : Integer.toString(index);
123        return HtmlTree.LABEL(htmlId.name(),
124            HtmlTree.INPUT("checkbox", htmlId)
125                .put(HtmlAttr.CHECKED, "")
126                .put(HtmlAttr.ONCLICK,
127                    "toggleGlobal(this, '" + releaseId + "', 3)"))
128            .add(HtmlTree.SPAN(releaseLabel));
129    }
130
131    @Override
132    protected void addExtraIndexLink(Content target) {
133        if (!builder.getForRemoval().isEmpty()) {
134            addIndexLink(HtmlIds.FOR_REMOVAL, "doclet.Terminally_Deprecated",
135                target);
136        }
137    }
138
139    @Override
140    protected void addComments(Element e, Content desc) {
141        List<? extends DeprecatedTree> tags = utils.getDeprecatedTrees(e);
142        if (!tags.isEmpty()) {
143            addInlineComment(e, tags.get(0), desc);
144        } else {
145            desc.add(Text.EMPTY);
146        }
147    }
148
149    @Override
150    protected void addTableTabs(Table<Element> table, String headingKey) {
151        List<String> releases = builder.releases;
152        if (!releases.isEmpty()) {
153            table.setGridStyle(HtmlStyle.threeColumnReleaseSummary);
154        }
155        if (releases.size() > 1) {
156            table.setDefaultTab(getTableCaption(headingKey))
157                .setAlwaysShowDefaultTab(true)
158                .setRenderTabs(false);
159            for (String release : releases) {
160                Content tab = TERMINALLY_DEPRECATED_KEY.equals(headingKey)
161                    ? contents.getContent(
162                        "doclet.Terminally_Deprecated_In_Release", release)
163                    : contents.getContent("doclet.Deprecated_In_Release",
164                        release);
165                table.addTab(tab,
166                    element -> release
167                        .equals(utils.getDeprecatedSince(element)));
168            }
169        }
170    }
171
172    @Override
173    protected Content getExtraContent(Element element) {
174        List<String> releases = builder.releases;
175        if (releases.isEmpty()) {
176            return null;
177        }
178        String deprecatedSince = utils.getDeprecatedSince(element);
179        return deprecatedSince == null || deprecatedSince.isEmpty()
180            ? Text.EMPTY
181            : Text.of(deprecatedSince);
182    }
183
184    @Override
185    protected TableHeader getTableHeader(String headerKey) {
186        List<String> releases = builder.releases;
187        if (releases.isEmpty()) {
188            return super.getTableHeader(headerKey);
189        }
190        return new TableHeader(
191            contents.getContent(headerKey),
192            contents
193                .getContent("doclet.Deprecated_Elements_Release_Column_Header"),
194            contents.descriptionLabel)
195                .sortable(true, true, false); // Allow sorting by element name
196                                              // and release
197    }
198
199    @Override
200    protected HtmlStyle[] getColumnStyles() {
201        List<String> releases = builder.releases;
202        if (releases.isEmpty()) {
203            return super.getColumnStyles();
204        }
205        return new HtmlStyle[] { HtmlStyle.colSummaryItemName,
206            HtmlStyle.colSecond, HtmlStyle.colLast };
207    }
208
209    @Override
210    protected Content getTableCaption(String headingKey) {
211        Content caption = contents.getContent(headingKey);
212        return TERMINALLY_DEPRECATED_KEY.equals(headingKey)
213            ? caption
214            : contents.getContent("doclet.Deprecated_Elements", caption);
215    }
216}
